question:
At the time of their appointment:
  1. a chief minister must be a member of either State Assembly or State Legislative Council
  2. the prime minister must be member of either Lok Sabha or Rajya Sabha
Which of the above is / are correct?
explanation:
Kindly keep in mind the below twoÂ provisions
  • Article 75 (5): A Minister who for any period of six consecutive months is not a member of either House of Parliament shall at the expiration of that period cease to be a Minister.
  • Article 164 (4): A Minister who for any period of six consecutive months is not a member of the Legislature of the State shall at the expiration of that period cease to be a Minister
